Package com.intellij.lang.documentation

Interface DocumentationProvider

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CodeDocumentationProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDocumentationProvider, AntDomDocumentationProvider, CommandLineDocumentationProvider, CompositeDocumentationProvider, DocumentationProviderEx, DomDocumentationProvider, GroovyDocumentationProvider, HtmlDocumentationProvider, ImageDocumentationProvider, InspectionDescriptionDocumentationProvider, JavaDocumentationProvider, JsonSchemaDocumentationProvider, LiveTemplateDocumentationProvider, PropertiesDocumentationProvider, PydevDocumentationProvider, PythonDocumentationProvider, PythonExternalDocumentationProvider, RegExpDocumentationProvider, RngCompactLanguage.MyDocumentationProvider, RngDocumentationProvider, ShDocumentationProvider, StructuralSearchTemplateDocumentationProvider, TaskDocumentationProvider, WebReferenceDocumentationProvider, XHtmlDocumentationProvider, XmlDocumentationProvider, XsltDocumentationProvider, YamlDocumentationProviderBase, YamlJsonSchemaDocumentationProvider

    public interface DocumentationProvider
    Provides documentation for PSI elements.

    Extend AbstractDocumentationProvider.

    See Also:
    LanguageDocumentation, DocumentationProviderEx, ExternalDocumentationProvider, ExternalDocumentationHandler

      Please use LanguageDocumentation instead of this for language-specific documentation

    • Field Detail

      • EP_NAME

        static final ExtensionPointName<DocumentationProvider> EP_NAME
        Please use LanguageDocumentation instead of this for language-specific documentation

    • Method Detail

      • getQuickNavigateInfo

        default java.lang.String getQuickNavigateInfo(PsiElement element,
                                              PsiElement originalElement)
        Returns the text to show in the Ctrl-hover popup for the specified element.
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which the documentation is requested (for example, if the mouse is over a method reference, this will be the method to which the reference is resolved).
        originalElement - the element under the mouse cursor
        Returns:
        the documentation to show, or null if the provider can't provide any documentation for this element. Documentation can contain HTML markup. If HTML special characters need to be shown in popup, they should be properly escaped.

      • getUrlFor

        default java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUrlFor(PsiElement element,
                                                   PsiElement originalElement)
        Returns the list of possible URLs to show as external documentation for the specified element.
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which the documentation is requested (for example, if the mouse is over a method reference, this will be the method to which the reference is resolved).
        originalElement - the element under the mouse cursor
        Returns:
        the list of URLs to open in the browser or to use for showing documentation internally (ExternalDocumentationProvider). If the list contains a single URL, it will be opened. If the list contains multiple URLs, the user will be prompted to choose one of them. For ExternalDocumentationProvider, first URL, yielding non-empty result in ExternalDocumentationProvider.fetchExternalDocumentation(Project, PsiElement, List) will be used.

      • generateDoc

        default java.lang.String generateDoc(PsiElement element,
                                     PsiElement originalElement)

        Callback for asking the doc provider for the complete documentation. Underlying implementation may be time-consuming, that's why this method is expected not to be called from EDT.

        One can use DocumentationMarkup to get proper content layout. Typical sample will look like this: 

         DEFINITION_START + definition + DEFINITION_END +
 CONTENT_START + main description + CONTENT_END +
 SECTIONS_START +
   SECTION_HEADER_START + section name +
     SECTION_SEPARATOR + "<p>" + section content + SECTION_END +
   ... +
 SECTIONS_END

        To show different content on mouse hover in editor, generateHoverDoc(PsiElement, PsiElement) should be implemented.
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which the documentation is requested (for example, if the mouse is over a method reference, this will be the method to which the reference is resolved).
        originalElement - the element under the mouse cursor
        Returns:
        target element's documentation, or null if provider is unable to generate documentation for the given element

      • generateHoverDoc

        default java.lang.String generateHoverDoc(PsiElement element,
                                          PsiElement originalElement)
        Same as generateDoc(PsiElement, PsiElement), but used for documentation showed on mouse hover in editor.

        At the moment it's only invoked to get initial on-hover documentation. If user navigates any link in that documentation, generateDoc(PsiElement, PsiElement) will be used to fetch corresponding content.

      • generateRenderedDoc

        default java.lang.String generateRenderedDoc(PsiElement element)
        This is used to display rendered documentation in editor, in place of corresponding documentation comment's text. Documentation comment PSI elements should implement PsiDocCommentBase for this functionality to work. Value returned by PsiDocCommentBase.getOwner() will be passed as element parameter to this method.
        See Also:
        collectDocComments(PsiFile, Consumer)

      • collectDocComments

        default void collectDocComments(PsiFile file,
                                java.util.function.Consumer<PsiDocCommentBase> sink)
        This defines documentation comments in file, which can be rendered in place. HTML content to be displayed will be obtained using generateRenderedDoc(PsiElement) method.

      • getDocumentationElementForLookupItem

        default PsiElement getDocumentationElementForLookupItem(PsiManager psiManager,
                                                        java.lang.Object object,
                                                        PsiElement element)

      • getDocumentationElementForLink

        default PsiElement getDocumentationElementForLink(PsiManager psiManager,
                                                  java.lang.String link,
                                                  PsiElement context)
        Returns the target element for a link in a documentation comment. The link needs to use the DocumentationManagerProtocol.PSI_ELEMENT_PROTOCOL protocol.
        Parameters:
        psiManager - the PSI manager for the project in which the documentation is requested.
        link - the text of the link, not including the protocol.
        context - the element from which the navigation is performed.
        Returns:
        the navigation target, or null if the link couldn't be resolved.
        See Also:
        DocumentationManagerUtil.createHyperlink(StringBuilder, String, String, boolean)

      • getCustomDocumentationElement

        default PsiElement getCustomDocumentationElement(Editor editor,
                                                 PsiFile file,
                                                 PsiElement contextElement,
                                                 int targetOffset)
        Override this method if standard platform's choice for target PSI element to show documentation for (element either declared or referenced at target offset) isn't suitable for your language. For example, it could be a keyword where there's no PsiReference, but for which users might benefit from context help.
        Parameters:
        targetOffset - equals to caret offset for 'Quick Documentation' action, and to offset under mouse cursor for documentation shown on mouse hover
        contextElement - the leaf PSI element in file at target offset
        Returns:
        target PSI element to show documentation for, or null if it should be determined by standard platform's logic (default behaviour)
